channel.title: C, C++, and C# Compilers, Tutorials, and Programs List
channel.description:
[b][size=14pt]C, C++, and C# Compilers, Tutorials, and Programs List[/size][/b]
Okay. Seeing as I wanted to learn C++ (Thanks to Ron), I decided to Google a bunch of starting things. I found Compilers, Tutorials, and Programs. Of course you all could do this, but I figured it would be useful to just give you links. Here ya go ;D
Keep note they are all free :)
All links with a * next to them mean you have to register.
[b][url=http://www.freebyte.com/programming/cpp/]An All In One[/url][/b]
[b][u]Compilers[/u][/b]
[url=http://www.thefreecountry.com/compilers/cpp.shtml]C/C++ Compilers[/url] [url=http://www.digitalmars.com/]More C/C++ Compilers[/url] [url=http://www.freeprogrammingresources.com/cppcomp.html]More C/C++ Compilers...[/url] [url=http://fabrice.bellard.free.fr/tcc/]C Compiler[/url] [url=http://www.ghs.com/products/c_optimizing_compilers.html]Another C/C++ Compiler[/url] [url=http://blogs.msdn.com/jmstall/archive/2005/02/06/368192.aspx]C# Compiler[/url] [url=http://mono.ximian.com/c-sharp.html]Another C# Compiler[/url]
[b][u]Programs[/u][/b]
[url=http://msdn.microsoft.com/vstudio/express/downloads/default.aspx]Starters, And Microsoft Programs[/url] [url=http://mono.ximian.com/c-sharp.html]C# Program[/url] [url=http://www.aisto.com/roeder/dotnet/]C# Reflector[/url] [url=http://www.myzips.com/listings/C++-Tools/Programming/44/]C++ Tools[/url] [url=http://www.obsoft.com/Product/CPlusPlus.html]C++ Toolset[/url] [url=http://dmoz.org/Computers/Programming/Languages/C%2b%2b/]More C++ Tools[/url] [url=http://www.codework.com/cpptools.html]C/C++ Tools[/url] [url=http://www.spinroot.com/static/]C Tools[/url] [url=http://www.cancer.org/docroot/PRO/content/PRO_1_1_CTools_Registration.asp]More C Tools *[/url] [url=http://www.freeprogrammingresources.com/csharptools.html]C# Tools[/url] [url=http://www.csharp-station.com/Tools.aspx]More C# Tools[/url]
[b][u]Tutorials[/u][/b]
[url=http://www.programmingtutorials.com/]Tutorials On Over 300 Languages[/url] [url=http://cplus.about.com/]C, C++, And C# Tutorials[/url] [url=http://csharpcomputing.com/Tutorials/TOC.htm]C# Tutorials[/url] [url=http://www.csharp-station.com/Tutorial.aspx]Other C# Tutorials[/url] [url=http://www.cprogramming.com/]C And C++ Tutorials[/url] [url=http://www.cs.cf.ac.uk/Dave/C/]Programing In C[/url] [url=http://www.cyberdiem.com/vin/learn.html]Learning C/C++[/url] [url=http://www.imada.sdu.dk/~svalle/courses/dm14-2005/mirror/c/]C Programming[/url] [url=http://www.glenmccl.com/tutor.htm]C++ Tutorials[/url] [url=http://directory.google.com/Top/Computers/Programming/Languages/C/Tutorials/]C Tutorials[/url] [url=http://www.andymcm.com/csharpfaq.htm]C# FAQs[/url] [url=http://www.acceleratedcpp.com/]C++ Tutorials from Niall[/url]
If there is something you would like added to the list, please tell me ;)

item.title: C, C++, and C# Compilers, Tutorials, and Programs List
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:1, topic:102143”]Okay. Seeing as I wanted to learn C++ (Thanks to Ron), I decided to Google a bunch of starting things. I found Compilers, Tutorials, and Programs. Of course you all could do this, but I figured it would be useful to just give you links. Here ya go ;D[/quote]gj.

item.title: C, C++, and C# Compilers, Tutorials, and Programs List
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:20, topic:102143”]Funny. Lin makes a topic about wanting to learn Cpp, C and C# ages ago, but never learns it. Nice. How can you learn something if you cannot find interest in it.[/quote]I don’t remember that topic, But I haven’t really taken interest in it until I got Zelda games open-source in C. I took some C program and learned off of it, which was to view models and then move them. It was actually easy, so yes I have learned some of these. Though right now, I’m busy ROM Hacking in VB so I don’t feel the need to learn these right now.

PS: Where did I say I wanted to learn them?

Read full topic

Hyjall:

You obviously come from moparscape, where rep is like water. We like to treat rep as it is worth something here.

But moparscape is from Ethiopia, where water is extremely valuable. Get your analogies straight please.
